channel.title: sM's every 10 seconds

item.title: sM's every 10 seconds
item.dc:creator: @Kayceee Kayceee
item.description:
@Kayceee wrote:

	public void timedAnnouncer() { /*Method name*/
			EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(
		new Event() {
			public void execute(EventContainer c) {
			sendMessage("YOUR MESSAGE HERE");
			sendMessage("@blu@ YOUR @bla@ MESSAGE @red@ HERE");	//Change to your message
			
			}
		},1000000); // 14 Minutes
	};
	public void timedAnnouncer2() { /*Method name*/
			EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(
		new Event() {
			public void execute(EventContainer c) {
			sendMessage("YOUR MESSAGE HERE");
			}
		},1000000); // 14 Minutes
	};
	public void frame74(int songID) 
	{
		outStream.createFrame(74);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(songID);
	}
	public void timedFade() { /*Method name*/
			EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(
		new Event() {
			public void execute(EventContainer c) {
			interFaceplay();	
				}
		}, 2400); // Time between each announcement
	};

I think this is what you’re looking for?
Just change it to your requirements

Read full topic

item.title: sM's every 10 seconds
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

Does anyone know if it’s possible to have such timer that will send a few sM’s every 10 seconds in a row that I chose?

For example:
sM(“message1.”);
10 seconds later
sM(“message 2.”);

and on and on… without the use of process, I have no idea how to begin with this.

Read full topic
